alert.note: Alert for Northern Berkshire; Southern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 10:23AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...POCKETS OF FREEZING DRIZZLE INTO THIS AFTERNOON... The widespread mixed precipitation of snow, sleet and freezing rain has ended. However, pockets of light freezing drizzle and light freezing rain will continue across the eastern Catskills, Mohawk Valley, Greater Capital Region, southern Adirondacks, the Lake George northern Saratoga Region, northern Taconics, and western New England into the early afternoon. A little sleet and snow may mix in over the southern Adirondacks and southern Greens. Little or no additional snow or sleet accumulation is expected. Spotty light glazes of ice are possible on untreated surfaces. Temperatures will only slowly rise into the mid 20s to lower 30s across the region into this afternoon.
